title: Drawing, "Tequendama Falls near Bogotá, Colombia", July 1853
medium: Graphite, white gouache on buff wove paper
markings: Stamps: lower left: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration
inscribed: in graphite, center, right bank: All trees; below: Moss; Moss and trickling/water; at lower right: Beautiful green weedy. . . (?) / 3 Rich ochrous or-ange / 4 more red and less brilliant than 3 / 5 duller than 4 but lighter. All of these rocks are / interspersed with bushes and weeds with the ex- ception / of 3 and 4 / 6 moss-Rocks in the stream generally brown. / Inscribed at lower left: The Fall of Tequendama / near Bogota NG / Height 670 ft.
description: View of river cascading over long and precipitous descent in a series of waterfalls. Trees and plants grow from rocks and boulders surrounding the rushing white water. Color and descriptive notes throughout.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Tequendama Falls near Bogotá, Colombia", July 1853.
July 1853. Graphite, white gouache on buff wove paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-260.
